title: R for Reproducibility
text:
Preface
This web-book is the companion to the course ‘Open Science Practices: Implementing a Reproducible Workflow in R’ (and other iterations) given by Daniela Palleschi at the Humboldt-Universität zu Berlin. The tools discussed in this book are specific to the R enviornment, but the concepts are universal and programming language agnostic.

title: R for Reproducibility
text:
Aims of the book

teach students basic concepts of reprodubility and replication in the scope of language research
introduce students to create and maintain self-contained analyses projects
help students develop good habits for project management
teach students how to write up analyses for a paper or thesis
introduce students to concepts like version control and containerization

title: R for Reproducibility
section: What you will not learn in this book
text:
What you will not learn in this book

how to analyse data
how to fit models
how to plot data
how to design an experiment

title: R for Reproducibility
text:
About this book
This book was created using a Quarto Book RProject (quarto?). The glossary for each chapter was created using the glossary package (glossary?). The source code for each chapter is viewable by clicking the <> Code button at the top right of the page. The source code for the whole book is also available via GitHub, and is fully reproducible.
